thread.title: Travel agent warns of fraud scam
thread.title_full: Travel agent warns of fraud scam

title: Travel agent warns of fraud scam
text:
Save 
A travel agent is warning others in the industry to be aware, after discovering that a fraudster has been trying to sell holidays, masquerading as her agency. 
London-based Cream Travel owner Roz Webster told TTG she wanted to alert the trade, after finding out that a fraudster had made £15,000 worth of hotel bookings through the Gateway booking portal. 
Gateway had emailed the invoice to the fraudster, who had provided a Yahoo email address, but had received no response and so contacted Cream Travel to find out what was going on. 
“They had booked three hotels in Spain in a very short space of time, using our name and website and contact details, but it was nothing to do with us,” Webster said. “It was all very odd – I want others to be aware of this.” 
Webster is now going to report the incident to the police, adding that she was concerned the fraudster was likely to target other agencies. 
“I doubt I’m the only one that this has happened to. I just feel for the poor people who think they have booked these hotel rooms but will turn up and they won’t be booked.”
